title: NC Parks Planner
skills: Vue.js, MVVM, Flexbox, Google Maps API, JavaScript frameworks, CSS frameworks, Webpack, ESLint
description: An interactive road trip planner for state parks in North Carolina that tallies your total distance and driving time as you add and remove destinations. Loads in information from a JSON using Axios and uses the CSS framework Bulma for styling.

title: Contact Manager
description: A contacts manager that implements CRUD using a MySql database, PHP, and phpMyAdmin. Also features a styleguide for typography, colors, and other UI design elements.

title: Food Insecurity in the US
skills: Data visualization, highcharts and highmaps, AJAX, JSON, XML
description: A journalistic data visualization using AJAX to create charts and maps. This site uses CSS from the LA Times for educational purposes and to fulfill the assignment guidelines, but I am not in any way affiliated with them.

title: What is a Meteor Shower?
skills: Javascript, jQuery, plugins, After Effects animation
description: An educational interactive slider inspired by my love of space. This was my first foray into animation and I created all gifs in Photoshop and After Effects. One slide features a draggable object that changes the CSS of that slide, created using jQuery.

title: Stay in the Loop
description: A mobile site that pulls in the top 5 trends in America from Twitter, then displays posts with those tags from various social media sites using PHP and JavaScript to parse the data. (Instagram recently changed their API, so that section no longer functions.)

title: The JK Business
description: An informational site about the schoolgirl dating industry in Japan. It uses information from a survey my research group gathered during my study abroad experience at Keio University to populate charts.

title: CSS dashboard
description: This was a class project where we were given an image of a site in Photoshop and told to rebuild it as closely as possible as a responsive site.
